verses.roman:
kibā āmi anna-pātre bhrame nā bāḍila!'
eta cinti' pāka-pātra yāñā dekhila

synonyms: kibā—or; āmi—I; anna-pātre—on the plate for food; bhrame—by mistake; nā bāḍila—did not put anything; eta cinti'-thinking this; pāka-pātra—the kitchen pots; yāñā dekhila—went and saw.
translation: "She thought, 'Perhaps by mistake I did not put any food on the plate.' So thinking, she went into the kitchen and saw the pots.
